dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, uh, kicking off with some news from the UK, the Information Commissioner's Office, the ICO, they released this report about pro-Brexit campaigns and their use of data.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, uh, kicking off with some news from the U K, the Information Commissioner's Office, the I C O, they released this report about pro-Brexit campaigns and their use of data.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The news comes as the U.K. Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) released a report into pro-Brexit campaigns' use of data.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, right. And initially, they were like, "no fines" for Aaron Banks and Leave.EU, which, [overlaps] I remember thinking, "Really?"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, right. And initially, they were like, "no fines" for Aaron Banks and Leave.E U, which, I remember thinking, "Really?"
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That resulted in proposed fines on organizations run by Brexit's biggest single donor, Aaron Banks, and Leave.EU totalling £135,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Exactly! Like, wait, what? But then, a government audit came out, and it's like, actually, those fines are gonna total £135,000. So, that's, uh, *quite* a different story.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! Like, wait, what? But then, a government audit came out, and it's like, actually, those fines are gonna total one hundred thirty five thousand pounds. So, that's, uh, quite a different story.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That resulted in proposed fines on organizations run by Brexit's biggest single donor, Aaron Banks, and Leave.EU totalling £135,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, a bit of a backtrack there. But then, the ICO spokesperson also said this Brexit probe actually expanded to include some tracking practices at Facebook.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, a bit of a backtrack there. But then, the I C O spokesperson also said this Brexit probe actually expanded to include some tracking practices at Facebook.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A spokesperson for ICO said its Brexit probe didn't expand to some tracking practises at Facebook.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's not just Brexit anymore. They're looking at Facebook's targeting functions, how they monitor individuals' browsing habits, interactions, all that across the internet and different devices.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's not just Brexit anymore. They're looking at Facebook's targeting functions, how they monitor individuals' browsing habits, interactions, all that across the internet and different devices.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are in the process of referring other outstanding issues about Facebooks targeting functions and techniques used to monitor individuals' browsing habits, interactions and behaviour across the internet and different devices to the Irish Data Protection Commission...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And because Facebook's, like, lead regulator under GDPR is in Ireland, the ICO has just handed all that information to Ireland's Data Protection Commission, the DPC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And because Facebook's, like, lead regulator under G D P R is in Ireland, the I C O has just handed all that information to Ireland's Data Protection Commission, the D P C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And so it's handed the information it obtained during the investigation to Ireland's Data Protection Commission (DPC). As per the ICO's report released Tuesday morning: We are in the process of referring other outstanding issues about Facebooks targeting functions... to the Irish Data Protection Commission, as the lead supervisory authority for Facebook under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, so it's now up to the DPC to assess all that. Although, interesting side note, the ICO spokesperson told Forbes that fake ads *won't* be included in that referral.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, so it's now up to the D P C to assess all that. Although, interesting side note, the I C O spokesperson told Forbes that fake ads won't be included in that referral.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ICO spokesperson told Forbes fake ads would be included in that referral.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Huh. Okay. I guess Facebook is saying they comply with, uh, EU data protection laws, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Huh. Okay. I guess Facebook is saying they comply with, uh, E U data protection laws, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A Facebook spokesperson said: We regularly engage with regulators regarding our advertising tools, which we believe fully comply with EU data protection laws.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. They're like, "We regularly engage with regulators, our advertising tools fully comply." But speaking of Facebook and ads, this last month has just been...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. They're like, "We regularly engage with regulators, our advertising tools fully comply." But speaking of Facebook and ads, this last month has just been...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, it's been a mess! Like, The Intercept showed they could advertise to people *uninterested* in white genocide. Which, you know, after Pittsburgh, is just...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it's been a mess! Like, The Intercept showed they could advertise to people uninterested in white genocide. Which, you know, after Pittsburgh, is just...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Intercept found last week it could advertise to those interested in white genocide.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's incredibly problematic. And then Vice tried to set up fake ads purportedly from Senators, and Facebook rejected them, even though they *should* have been approved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's incredibly problematic. And then Vice tried to set up fake ads purportedly from Senators, and Facebook rejected them, even though they should have been approved.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vice was able to set up ads purportedly backed by Senators. ... and Facebook approved the ads. Facebook admitted they never should have been approved.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Business Insider's ads, which claimed to be paid for by Cambridge Analytica, also got rejected. So much for that "Paid for by" feature being transparent, huh?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Business Insider's ads, which claimed to be paid for by Cambridge Analytica, also got rejected. So much for that "Paid for by" feature being transparent, huh?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And Business Insider reported Facebook approved its ads that claimed to have been paid for by Cambridge Analytica...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It's supposed to bring clarity, but it just seems like it's easily manipulated and, uh, causing more confusion than anything else.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It's supposed to bring clarity, but it just seems like it's easily manipulated and, uh, causing more confusion than anything else.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It appears that thanks to the obvious ease with which it can be manipulated, it may be causing more confusion than clarity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. I mean, it just feels like it's been a really embarrassing month for, like, tech and data ethics across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. I mean, it just feels like it's been a really embarrassing month for, like, tech and data ethics across the board.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, even Apple managed to kill that GrayKey iPhone passcode hack. So, some good news there, but a lot of questions remaining for Facebook and these regulators.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, even Apple managed to kill that GrayKey iPhone passcode hack. So, some good news there, but a lot of questions remaining for Facebook and these regulators.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple Just Killed The 'GrayKey' iPhone Passcode Hack

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. We'll definitely be keeping an eye on what the DPC decides on that one.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. We'll definitely be keeping an eye on what the D P C decides on that one.
